bug.author: zimenglyu
bug.summary: Looking for Tensorflow lite C++ Android NDK install instructions
bug.description: Can someone provide me documentation or examples of using Tensorflow lite + Android NDK C++. The only project example is in Java, but I need to use Tensorflow lite with the Android NDK in C++. I'm also using a Windows 10 computer and have the latest version of Bazel installed. Any steps, documentation, and example projects for Tensorflow lite + Android NDK C++ would be very beneficial to me and the community.. Thank you for any support

comments.comment: I‚Äôd also be interested in setup instructions. I got android studio to install tflite on the java side pretty easily. How can I get it to work in c++?

See this: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49834875/problems-with-using-tensorflow-lite-c-api-in-android-studio-project>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49834875/problems-with-using-tensorflow-lite-c-api-in-android-studio-project</denchmark-link>
You must use NDK 18. Don't use dropout in your model.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nimitz14>@nimitz14</denchmark-link> Should I go to NDK 18? or use what this warning suggests it supports? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22269225/48986040-77042880-f0dd-11e8-9ba1-173136bb20c0.jpeg></denchmark-link>
You can ignore that. See the last comment <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/4742>here</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ymodak>@ymodak</denchmark-link> I got it working on mac and I wrote a [blog] to introduce this process. Hope it would be helpful to others. <denchmark-link:https://zimenglyu.com/android/tensorflow/machinelearning/mobile/english/2018/11/27/tflite-android-ndk-eng.html>here</denchmark-link>
@cathybgyz looking forward to your blog! other resources seem more scatterbrained on the subject... Thank you üëç
Awesome. Thanks for your contribution. Can I close this issue now since you have found the workaround solution?
@cathybgyz Your blog is not online anymore. Can you point to a different link where the documentation is available?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rribani>@rribani</denchmark-link> Sorry about that, you can find it <denchmark-link:https://zimenglyu.com/en/ml/android/tensorflow/2018/11/27/tflite-android-ndk-eng.html>here</denchmark-link>
Is there any easier way to do that, for example, do not build it by oneself? Thanks!

@ymodak I got it working on mac and I wrote a [blog] to introduce this process. Hope it would be helpful to others. here
I see the link doesn't work. Can you please help?
